description: Researches and designs the user interface for the Matrix Flash Loan Arbitrage system

Researched Bellman-Ford and MMBF algorithms for cycle detection
Evaluated GNN and RL approaches for path optimization
Researched gas optimization techniques for multi-hop swaps
Analyzed Uniswap V4 singleton/flash accounting innovations

Train GNN path scorer on historical data
Implement direct pool calls (skip router overhead)
Deploy on Arbitrum/Base for low gas costs
Integrate Uniswap V4 flash accounting when live

history.result: Completed UI framework evaluation, identified EigenPhi as primary inspiration
Documented design patterns, EigenTx features, multi-chain support, and recommended implementation approach

history.action: Collaborated with THE ARCHITECT on Matrix Command Center dashboard
history.result: Created comprehensive wireframes for 6 sections: Overview, Competitor Intelligence, Our Opportunities, Strategy Center, AI Insights, Historical Analysis. Designed component library with Matrix Dark theme.
Created docs/MEV_PROTECTION_AND_TITAN_BUILDER_REPORT.md (1,194 lines) covering MEV landscape, Titan Builder integration, private RPC setup, and implementation guide

Archived completed work: EigenPhi analysis, wireframes, design system, component library, MEV report. Dashboard implementation complete with Live Prices, Wallet Management, Contract Viewer, WebSocket integration.

Created docs/MULTI_HOP_ARBITRAGE_RESEARCH.md - comprehensive research covering: current implementation analysis, MMBF algorithm (1000% more opportunities), GNN path scoring (78ms inference), RL trade sizing (SAC), cross-chain arbitrage ($9.5M market), latency optimization strategies. Recommended hybrid MMBF+GNN+RL architecture.

Added Section 6 to MULTI_HOP_ARBITRAGE_RESEARCH.md covering: gas cost breakdown per hop (150-200k gas/hop), Uniswap V4 flash accounting (99% reduction), top 10 smart contract optimization techniques, L2 gas comparisons (Arbitrum $0.03-0.15, Base $0.01-0.05), calldata optimization, MEV bundle optimization, gas-aware path selection algorithm, contract upgrade recommendations, and implementation checklist.
